page.title: 09LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: {BETCHWORTH UNITED CHARITIES}ADMIN DONE BY CHURCHES OF BETCHWORTH AND BROKHAM.MONEY COMES FROM SMITHS CHARITY/GENERAL CHARITY OF WORTH ESTATE IN FORM OF VOUCHERS FOR FOOD, WARMTH,CLOTHING,TOOLS FOR THE NEEDY. STORY IS THAT HENRY SMITH WAS PEDDLER {STORIES ABOUT GYPSIES,CANADIAN ARMY, {HASTY Ps,ZEPPELINS,DOODLE BUGS(FLYING {BOMBS),HOME GAURD IN PILL BOXES EXIST {AND ARE VERY FUNNY AND CONTAIN FEELING {FOR AREA NOT GAINED BY DRIVING THROUGH DATES-RICEBRIDGE FARM 1390,MILL ON SITE OF FLANCHFORD MILL IN DOMESDAY BOOK 1086.FRYLEIGH IS COLLECTION OF FARM BUILDINGS DATING FROM 1700s. BETCHWORTH CHURCH SITE WAS USED IN PRE NORMAN TIMES.PILL BOXES 1939-40.WONHAM MILL 1740.REMINDERS OF 1800s EXIST IN FORM OF ALMS HOUSES,WORK HOUSE,FEVER HOSPITAL,LAUNDRY AND POOR LAW STORIES. {ASK OLD FOLK TO TELL AND LISTEN AVIDLY
